bibl.author: Walt Whitman
bibl.title: Walt Whitman to Alexander Black, 12 May 1891
bibl.orgName: The Charles E. Feinberg Collection of the Papers of Walt Whitman, 1839–1919, Library of Congress, Washington, D.C.

dateline.name: From the Boston Eve'gEvening Transcript, May 7, '91.—The Epictetus saying, as given by Walt Whitman in his own quite utterly dilapidated physical case, is, a "little spark of soul dragging a great lummux of corpse-body clumsily to and fro around."
Camden N J

body.p: Couldn't remember distinctly enough to authenticate the desk (the pict: hereby return'd as your note seems to involve)—but I know I had a good time in the Times—& heartily send my best respects & love to the boys one & all now there—I send my last photo: Tack it up if you like on the wall you all most congregate.
